title: IMPRESA Dog Bells for Door Potty Training - Doggie Doorbell for Housetraining Your Doggy or Housebreaking Your Puppy (Dog Training Bells/Potty Training Dog Bell)
features: Train Nearly Any Puppy Or Dog: With our dog bells for door potty training / puppy training you can quickly & easily train nearly any puppy / doggy / grown dog to let you know when he/she needs to go outside. Most dogs quickly pick-up how to use our hanging dog training bells

Built To Last: Our doggie doorbell made from super strong, chew-resistant nylon tested by our very own poochie; multiple snap points make it easy to hang on any door at the height you choose; reinforced rivets will keep the bells firmly attached

Proven Effective: Dog potty training bells are proven as an effective method for housebreaking / house breaking, housetraining / house training and potty training for new puppies or a doggy of any age. Potty training dog bell usage is easier than you'd ever imagine!

Sleek, Attractive Appearance: Doggie's Gotta Go's black strap with polished metal hardware (similar to sleigh bells / chimes) looks great in nearly any home. Our hanger door bells actually look good, in addition to being effective for puppy potty training, and have a lovely ring / jingle to them

Tested And Trusted: Our dog doorbells / house training bells are tested, trusted and recommended by dog trainers. Also, a great small gift for new pets in a friend or loved one's home. Now with louder bells!
description: With our Doggie's Gotta Go doggie door bells housetraining your puppy orgrown dog has never been easier. No matter the age or breed of your pooch,you'll find our potty chimes training device easy to use and our system easy to follow. So how does it work? Step 1:  Hang the bells on the handle of the door you use totake your dog out. You can also hang them on a hook next to the door(a suitable hook can be found at any hardware store). Step 2:  Whenever you take your dog out, allow the dog to move or otherwiseinteract with the door knob bells. When he/she does so, ring the bells and statea command associated with going outside. Provide positive verbal feedback andtake your dog out. Step 3:  Repeat the process, always giving the same command and praise.Make sure that you don't distract your dog from going to the bathroom by playingafter you take him/her outside. If you're going outside to play, don't use thehanging house training bells. After a few weeks of this routine, most dogs will beginringing the bells on their own. When they do so, it is Very Important to takethem out right away to reinforce the conditioning.Bell training for dogs has been shown to be highly effective, with many trainersand books recommending dog door bells for potty training over other doggiepotty training devices / aids. Manufacturer's warranty guarantees product for life.
